What means “third-party”?

Third-Party plugins are not developed or maintained by us. This is just to centralize existing plugins for the users, so you have it easier finding them.

Third-Party Developers are also allowed to add changelog pages, error pages, information (FAQ) pages and so on and can help you a bit more.

I'm a developer and want to add my plugin

To add your plugin to this domain, you can fork and create the git repository from GitHub here and then create a PR.

You have to create in the loupedeck/third-party/ folder a new one with your name and in that a folder with the plugin name, then you can start adding your pages.

So the structure should look like this: /loupedeck/third-party/CREATORNAME/PLUGINNAME/home.md

Example: /loupedeck/third-party/MrAwesome/Counter/home.md

Attention!

Despite careful control of the content, we assume no liability for the content of third-party providers. The operators of the pages and plugins are solely responsible for their content.
